name: Preliminary two-photon calcium imaging data for 1R01NS136988-01: The functional role and neural basis of rapid turns in olfactory search behavior
citation: Ros, Ivo (2025) Preliminary two-photon calcium imaging data for 1R01NS136988-01: The functional role and neural basis of rapid turns in olfactory search behavior (Version draft) [Data set]. DANDI Archive. https://dandiarchive.org/dandiset/001565/draft
keywords: flight, central complex,  mechanosensation, GLNO, calcium imaging
description: Calcium imaging of putative members of the pathway that relays visual and mechanosensory information to the compass neurons in the central complex
studyTarget: We explore the role of mechanosensation in accurately estimating self-rotation during rapid flight saccades.  Like mammalian head-direction cells, flies update their heading representation via GLNO neurons that relay idiothetic sensory information to EPG compass neurons within the central complex. We functionally imaged left and right GLNO neuron activity in the fly brain, alongside recordings of wingstroke amplitudes during mechanical and visual stimulations at different simulated rotation speeds. Two-photon microscopy recordings use GCaMP7f, a Ca2+-indicator, alongside an activity-independent red fluorophore, tdTomato. tdTomato is used for image-stabilization and GCaMP-fluorescence normalization.
